description: Back-formation from pseudonymous, from French pseudonyme (“pseudonymous”, adjective), from Ancient Greek ψευδώνυμος (pseudṓnumos), from ψευδής (pseudḗs, “false”) and ὄνυμα (ónuma), a dialectal form of  ὄνομα (ónoma, “name”). Synchronically analyzable as pseudo- +‎ -onym.

entries.meaning: A fictitious name (more literally, a false name), as those used by writers and movie stars.
examples: The Reverend Charles Lutwidge Dodgson wrote "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" under the pseudonym Lewis Carroll.
